title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement ross@ecohealthallinace.org. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

what: Contributing to the doltr R package
title: Contributing to the doltr R package
text: want contribute doltr? Great! Please submit questions, bug reports, requests issues tracker. Please submit bug reports minimal reprex. Note wrapper around dolt RMariaDB. Issues may due programs likely due interactions programs. Bear us. plan contribute code, go ahead fork repo submit pull request. notes: package released Contributor Code Conduct. participating project agree abide terms. ? want contribution enjoyable rewarding everyone! large change, please open issue first discuss. ’ll generally include contributors authors DESCRIPTION file (permission) contributions go beyond small typos code documentation. package generally uses rOpenSci packaging guidelines style structure. Documentation generated roxygen2. Please write documentation code files let auto-generate documentation files. use recent version documentation written markdown aim testing high coverage robust. Include tests major contribution code. Test changes package submitting change.

title: Contributing to the doltr R package
text: Please take look issues tracker ’m working contribute . dolt rapidly developing doltr need track keep changes. general, goal DBI-compliant interface wraps RMariaDB enhanced features specific dolt, high-level gert-like interface versioning-related functionality. DBI-compliance vis DBItest package ways go, help welcome. number doltr functions wrap dolt command-line tool, general wherever possible functions interact database via DBI/SQL route. functionality becomes available via SQL route incorporate . relatively “heavy” dependency package rather minimal DBI interface add convenience functions specific Dolt specific workflows. need minimal client, RMariaDB can used interface Dolt databases far fewer dependencies, functionality can achieved via system() calls Dolt CLI Interface. package developed support internal projects EcoHealth Alliance. strive good contributors open-source ecosystem general-purpose tool, internal needs drive prioritization design decisions.

title: Authors
text: Noam Ross. Author, maintainer. EcoHealth Alliance. Copyright holder.

what: A client for the dolt database
title: A client for the dolt database
text: doltr client dolt, SQL database git-like versioning. work progress, fully documented, API isn’t fully baked yet.

title: A client for the dolt database
text: need dolt installed machine. Get . Install R package
code: remotes::install_github("ecohealthalliance/doltr")

title: A client for the dolt database
text: package provides two DBI-compliant drivers connect dolt database. dolt_remote() connects dolt server via TCP. dolt_local() connects local database directory. (Behind scenes dolt_local() launches manages background server process, can also done manually dolt_server()). dolt() serves connection cached R session connects via default parameters can defined via environment variables. (See ?config). dolt_pane() Provides RStudio connection pane showing database. variety dolt_* functions provide database information versioning capability. See help files dolt documentation.

title: A client for the dolt database
text: Please note dolt project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: Find and check for the presence of a dolt binary — is_dolt_installed
title: Find and check for the presence of a dolt binary — is_dolt_installed
text: Find check presence dolt binary

title: Find and check for the presence of a dolt binary — is_dolt_installed
code: is_dolt_installed()  dolt_version()  dolt_path()

what: Get and set Dolt configuration variables — dolt-config
title: Get and set Dolt configuration variables — dolt-config
text: Get set Dolt configuration variables

title: Get and set Dolt configuration variables — dolt-config
code: dolt_config_get(   params = NULL,   global = TRUE,   local_dir = Sys.getenv("DOLT_DIR") )  dolt_config_set(params, global = TRUE, local_dir = Sys.getenv("DOLT_DIR"))

title: Get and set Dolt configuration variables — dolt-config
text: params parameters get set. Can include user.name, user.email, user.creds.  dolt_config_set, named character vector list parameter names values. global Set global database-specific credentials local_dir global, local database set variables

what: Connect to a dolt database — dolt_remote
title: Connect to a dolt database — dolt_remote
text: dolt_remote() DBI Driver connect remote dolt server via port. , DoltDriver, DoltConnection class wrappers around around classes methods RMariaDB package. parameters can specified package configuration environment variables.

title: Connect to a dolt database — dolt_remote
code: dolt_remote()  # S4 method for DoltDriver dbUnloadDriver(drv, ...)  # S4 method for DoltDriver show(object)  # S4 method for DoltDriver dbConnect(   drv = dolt_remote(),   dbname = Sys.getenv("DOLT_DIR", "doltdb"),   username = Sys.getenv("DOLT_USERNAME", "root"),   password = Sys.getenv("DOLT_PASSWORD", ""),   host = Sys.getenv("DOLT_HOST", "127.0.0.1"),   port = Sys.getenv("DOLT_PORT", 3306L),   autocommit = TRUE,   ... )

title: Connect to a dolt database — dolt_remote
text: drv object class DoltDriver, created dolt_remote(). ... arguments passed RMariaDB::MariaDB object connection object dbname database name username username. Defaults "root" password login password.  Defaults empty. host IP host. Defaults local machine, 127.0.0.1 port TCP port connections. Defaults 3306. autocommit Whether autocommit changes SQL sense. , flush pending changes disk update working set.

title: Connect to a dolt database — dolt_remote
text: methods fall back RMariaDB.

what: Examine information about dolt tables and diffs — dolt_diffs
title: Examine information about dolt tables and diffs — dolt_diffs
text: Examine information dolt tables diffs

title: Examine information about dolt tables and diffs — dolt_diffs
code: dolt_diffs(table, to, conn = dolt(), collect = NULL, show_sql = NULL)  dolt_table_history(table, conn = dolt(), collect = NULL, show_sql = NULL)

title: Examine information about dolt tables and diffs — dolt_diffs
text: table character name table database commit compare conn database connection collect whether collect result R return dbplyr::tbl_lazy() processed collecting.  Defaults TRUE, can set environment variable DOLT_COLLECT. show_sql Whether print SQL statements used internally fetch data. Useful learning Dolt works internally. Defaults FALSE, can set environment variable DOLT_VERBOSE.

what: Get information about a Dolt Database — dbGetInfo,DoltConnection-method
title: Get information about a Dolt Database — dbGetInfo,DoltConnection-method
text: Dolt dbGetInfo() returns standard information database connection according DBI specification, well information version-control status repository current branch, last commit, modified tables.  information also displayed print method dolt connection object RStudio connection pane.

title: Get information about a Dolt Database — dbGetInfo,DoltConnection-method
code: # S4 method for DoltConnection dbGetInfo(dbObj, ...)  # S4 method for DoltConnection show(object)

title: Get information about a Dolt Database — dbGetInfo,DoltConnection-method
text: dbObj database connection ... arguments methods object database connection

title: Miscellaneous Dolt Methods — dbSendQuery,DoltConnection,character-method
text: methods largely wrap RMariaDB methods small tweaks work Dolt databases.

title: Miscellaneous Dolt Methods — dbSendQuery,DoltConnection,character-method
code: # S4 method for DoltConnection,character dbSendQuery(conn, statement, params = NULL, ...)  # S4 method for DoltConnection,character dbSendStatement(conn, statement, params = NULL, ...)  # S4 method for DoltResult dbClearResult(res, ...)  # S4 method for DoltConnection dbDisconnect(conn, ...)

title: Miscellaneous Dolt Methods — dbSendQuery,DoltConnection,character-method
text: conn DoltConnection object. statement character vector length one specifying SQL statement executed.  single SQL statement provided. params list query parameters substituted parameterized query. ... Unused. Needed compatibility generic.#' @export res  DoltResult object.

title: Navigate dolt history — dolt_checkout
text: dolt_checkout() checks dolt branch, setting branch HEAD bringing tip. dolt_use() sets database use specific commit state puts read-mode.

title: Navigate dolt history — dolt_checkout
code: dolt_checkout(   branch,   b = FALSE,   start_point = NULL,   conn = dolt(),   collect = NULL,   show_sql = NULL )  dolt_use(hash = NULL, conn = dolt())

title: Navigate dolt history — dolt_checkout
text: branch branch check b whether create new branch start_point commit hash branch start. NULL, starts current HEAD. conn database connection collect whether collect result R return dbplyr::tbl_lazy() processed collecting.  Defaults TRUE, can set environment variable DOLT_COLLECT. show_sql Whether print SQL statements used internally fetch data. Useful learning Dolt works internally. Defaults FALSE, can set environment variable DOLT_VERBOSE. hash commit hash want set database . NULL, checks head main branch brings read-mode.

Unused, needed compatibility generic. row.names Either TRUE, FALSE, NA string. TRUE, always translate row names column called "row_names". FALSE, never translate row names. NA, translate rownames character vector. string equivalent TRUE, allows override default name. backward compatibility, NULL equivalent FALSE. check.names TRUE, default, column names converted valid R identifiers. prefix fully qualified path database's namespace, NULL. argument processed dbUnquoteIdentifier(). given method return objects accessible prefix.

what: Work with dolt repository remotes — dolt_push

code: dolt_push(   remote = NULL,   ref = NULL,   set_upstream = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   conn = dolt(),   collect = NULL,   show_sql = NULL )  dolt_pull(   remote = NULL,   squash = FALSE,   conn = dolt(),   collect = NULL,   show_sql = NULL )  dolt_fetch(   remote = NULL,   ref = FALSE,   force = FALSE,   conn = dolt(),   collect = NULL,   show_sql = NULL )  dolt_clone(   remote_url,   remote = "origin",   new_dir = basename(remote_url),   branch = NULL )

text: remote name remote. "origin" used default ref branch reference set_upstream whether set remote branch reference track force whether overwrite conflicting history current branch conn database connection collect whether collect result R return dbplyr::tbl_lazy() processed collecting.  Defaults TRUE, can set environment variable DOLT_COLLECT. show_sql Whether print SQL statements used internally fetch data. Useful learning Dolt works internally. Defaults FALSE, can set environment variable DOLT_VERBOSE. squash whether merge changes working set without updating commit history remote_url remote URL clone new_dir directory clone branch branch clone. NULL, clones branches

text: tables tables reset? Defaults tables NULL. conn database connection collect whether collect result R return dbplyr::tbl_lazy() processed collecting.  Defaults TRUE, can set environment variable DOLT_COLLECT. show_sql Whether print SQL statements used internally fetch data. Useful learning Dolt works internally. Defaults FALSE, can set environment variable DOLT_VERBOSE. stage tables committing? message commit message. NULL interactive session, user prompted. Otherwise error empty. author, date Author date. null, uses ones set dolt-config. Author format "U Thor author@example.com" allow_empty Allow recording commit exact data sole parent. usually mistake, FALSE default. hard Reset working staged tables? FALSE (default), "soft" reset performed, unstaging staged tables.  TRUE, working staged changes discarded.

title: Dolt Data Types — dbDataType,DoltConnection-method
text: dbDataType matches R data types dolt data types. text blob data types, automatically chooses amongst options (e.g., VARCHAR(N), TEXT, LONGTEXT, etc.) based maximum field length.  attribute maximum size fields returned support operations fields need recast revision.

title: Dolt Data Types — dbDataType,DoltConnection-method
text: dbObj database connection obj data type (vector data frame) min_varchar minimum size VARCHAR types cast max_varchar maximum size VARCHAR types cast . Larger text data return types TEXT,MEDIUMTEXT, LONGTEXT ... arguments methods types character vector dolt types, e.g., "VARCHAR(12)", "LONGBLOB", "TINYINT", etc.

title: Configuration variable options — dolt-vars
text: doltr package's behavior can modified setting environment variables:

title: Configuration variable options — dolt-vars
text: DOLT_DIR set default directory look dolt database run server using dolt_local() dolt(). Defaults "doltdb". DOLT_PORT sets port connect run server . Defaults 3306. DOLT_HOST sets host IP connect run server . Defaults 127.0.0.1. DOLT_CONFIG_FILE path file additional configuration options dolt sql server. See https://docs.dolthub.com/interfaces/cli#dolt-sql-server options. DOLT_PATH specifies path dolt binary running locally. Defaults one found system path. DOLT_COLLECT specifies whether dolt convenience functions returning data return fully collected tibbles lazy tibbles processing. Set 0 false disable, potentially large databases long histories yield large responses commands like dolt_log() dolt_diffs(). DOLT_VERBOSE print SQL command-line statements executed running functions wrap database system calls. Useful understanding dolt commands work. Set 1 true enable behavior. DOLT_WATCH determines whether RStudio Connection pane automatically updates response changes database.  Set 0 false disable behavior. DOLT_ROOT_DIR directory Dolt global configuration credential data stored (~/.dolt default). Note can also set shell configure command-line dolt.

what: Write a table to the database — dbWriteTable,DoltConnection,character,data.frame-method
title: Write a table to the database — dbWriteTable,DoltConnection,character,data.frame-method
text: method uses dbx::dbxInsert() implementation much performant standard method RMariaDB::dbWriteTable(), due way Dolt handles repeat INSERT statements.

title: Write a table to the database — dbWriteTable,DoltConnection,character,data.frame-method
code: # S4 method for DoltConnection,character,data.frame dbWriteTable(   conn,   name,   value,   field.types = NULL,   row.names = FALSE,   overwrite = FALSE,   append = FALSE,   temporary = FALSE,   batch_size = NULL )

title: Write a table to the database — dbWriteTable,DoltConnection,character,data.frame-method
text: conn database connection name table name value data frame. field.types Optional, overrides default choices field types, derived classes columns data frame. See dbDataType() row.names Either TRUE, FALSE, NA string. TRUE, always translate row names column called "row_names". FALSE, never translate row names. NA, translate rownames character vector. string equivalent TRUE, allows override default name. backward compatibility, NULL equivalent FALSE. overwrite logical specifying whether overwrite existing table . default FALSE. append logical specifying whether append existing table database  appending, table (temporary table) must exist, otherwise error reported. default FALSE. temporary TRUE, creates temporary table expires connection closed. dbRemoveTable(), temporary tables considered argument set TRUE batch_size number records insert single statement (defaults )

title: Write a table to the database — dbWriteTable,DoltConnection,character,data.frame-method
text: dependency dbx may removed base issue resolved: https://github.com/dolthub/dolt/issues/2091.

what: Return a (cached) connection to the default Dolt database — dolt

title: Return a (cached) connection to the default Dolt database — dolt
code: dolt(   dir = Sys.getenv("DOLT_DIR", "doltdb"),   dbname = NULL,   username = Sys.getenv("DOLT_USERNAME", "root"),   password = Sys.getenv("DOLT_PASSWORD", ""),   port = Sys.getenv("DOLT_PORT", 3306L),   host = Sys.getenv("DOLT_HOST", "127.0.0.1"),   cache_connection = TRUE,   ... )

title: Return a (cached) connection to the default Dolt database — dolt
text: dir directory server dolt_local() connection. "remote" dolt_remote() connection made server started. dbname remote connections, database name username username. Defaults "root" password login password.  Defaults empty. port TCP port connections. Defaults 3306. host IP host. Defaults local machine, 127.0.0.1 cache_connection preserve cache connection? allows faster load times prevents connection garbage-collected. ... arguments passed dolt_server() MariaDB()

what: Connect to a local dolt database directory — dolt_local
title: Connect to a local dolt database directory — dolt_local
text: dolt_local() creates DoltLocalDriver, can generate DoltLocalConnection.  Unlike dolt_remote() DoltDriver, local connections dolt databases stored directories -disk, take directory name argument. local connection type starts manages dolt SQL server background serving directory, connects returns connection. Parameters govern server connection Local dolt connection objects contain additional slots including database path -disk external pointer server process, returned via dbGetInfo displayed connection print method. dbDisconnect method kills background server processes connected . Multi-user , complicated networking set-ups use dolt_server() dolt_remote() directly.

title: Connect to a local dolt database directory — dolt_local
code: dolt_local()  # S4 method for DoltLocalDriver dbUnloadDriver(drv, ...)  # S4 method for DoltLocalDriver show(object)  # S4 method for DoltLocalDriver dbConnect(   drv,   dir = Sys.getenv("DOLT_DIR", "doltdb"),   username = Sys.getenv("DOLT_USERNAME", "root"),   password = Sys.getenv("DOLT_PASSWORD", ""),   port = Sys.getenv("DOLT_PORT", 3306L),   host = Sys.getenv("DOLT_HOST", "127.0.0.1"),   find_port = TRUE,   find_server = TRUE,   autocommit = TRUE,   server_args = list(),   ... )  # S4 method for DoltLocalConnection dbGetInfo(dbObj, ...)  # S4 method for DoltLocalConnection show(object)  # S4 method for DoltLocalConnection dbDisconnect(conn, ...)  # S4 method for DoltLocalConnection dbIsValid(dbObj, ...)

title: Connect to a local dolt database directory — dolt_local
text: drv object class DoltLocalDriver, created dolt_local(). ... additional arguments pass RMariaDB object connection object dir dolt directory serve connect username username. Defaults "root" password login password.  Defaults empty. port TCP port connections. Defaults 3306. host IP host. Defaults local machine, 127.0.0.1 find_port whether find open port default used another process find_server whether look another server process serving directory creating new one autocommit Whether autocommit changes SQL sense. , flush pending changes disk update working set. server_args list additional arguments pass dolt_server() dbObj database connection conn database connection

what: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: Start dolt SQL server return server process handle

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
code: dolt_server(   dir = Sys.getenv("DOLT_DIR", "doltdb"),   username = Sys.getenv("DOLT_USERNAME", "root"),   password = Sys.getenv("DOLT_PASSWORD", ""),   port = Sys.getenv("DOLT_PORT", 3306L),   host = Sys.getenv("DOLT_HOST", "127.0.0.1"),   find_port = TRUE,   find_server = TRUE,   multi_db = FALSE,   autocommit = TRUE,   read_only = FALSE,   log_level = "info",   log_out = NULL,   timeout = 0,   query_parallelism = 2,   max_connections = 100,   config_file = Sys.getenv("DOLT_CONFIG_FILE", "") )

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: dir dolt directory serve username username. Defaults "root" password login password.  Defaults empty. port TCP port connections. Defaults 3306. host IP host. Defaults local machine, 127.0.0.1 find_port TRUE, switch different port port used another process find_server TRUE, find server process serving directory rather starting new one. Note server options ignored. allows server used across R sessions. Note make best use may want turn "Quit child processes exit" option RStudio project options. multi_db Serve multiple databases? TRUE, dir directory multiple subdirectories dolt databases autocommit Automatically commit database changes working set? FALSE, anything manually committed lost. read_only database allow read_only connections? log_level Defines level logging provided. Options "trace", debug", "info", "warning", "error", "fatal" (default "info"). log_out logging output directed.  "|" passed std_out(), NULL (default), suppressed.  Can also take filename. See processx::run(). timeout Defines timeout, seconds, used connections value 0 represents infinite timeout (default 28800000) query_parallelism Set number go routines spawned handle query (default 2) max_connections Set number connections handled server (default 100) config_file path YAML config file set additional server configuration values.  See options dolt documentation.

title: Start up a dolt SQL server and return the server process handle — dolt_server
text: dolt_server object also ps::ps_handle()

what: doltr: A client for the dolt database — doltr-package
title: doltr: A client for the dolt database — doltr-package
text: Creates DBI-compliant interface dolt databases (<https://www.dolthub.com>). Also manages local dolt server processes, provides convenience functions dolt versioning, RStudio connection pane interface.

title: doltr: A client for the dolt database — doltr-package
